Specifically, a commit message in the active voice that is within the recommended character count for message subject and body. For example, "[AIRFLOW-XXX] Add 99 to the Companies list." Yes, this means that you do need to open a JIRA for this, since we track all PRs via JIRA.
@msumit @r39132 ok. I got it. Thanks for the reply, I'll change that :)
Cool. Though a trivial commit, we want to introduce contributors to our review-for-merge protocol. We generate release notes from the commit subject lines, so adherence to our protocols pays forward.

Good catch @bolkedebruin 

@normster As @bolkedebruin points out, you are not changing the intended function.  

It would be good to update the comment histories on both PR 1730 to this PR to reference each other. At the very least, as @bolkedebruin points out, we should reference the conversation and line we are changing here so that it's easy to track. We have a lot of PRs and can't keep it all in our heads.

For reference, I am adding the link here to the change we want to revert, but it should also be added to the PR description text box.

Hi, guys. Do you have an ETA on API? I am currently writing a plugin to parse custom definitions into dags, but need more API for front end and was about to hack something myself using sql alchemy connections to DB. But excited that I might not need to do it. 
Do you need any help? I can at least help with tedious Swagger interface definitions, which now becoming de-facto for REST discovery.  [https://github.com/OAI/OpenAPI-Specification](https://github.com/OAI/OpenAPI-Specification) I use, flask-swagger in my plugin it's mostly manual, but at least in place.
NOTE: This is still very much in progress. Dropping the PR in here so that I can see how the tests are looking as I work on this; will update and squash my commits once it's done.

Shouldn't showing them be the default? I only go to the dag list page to pause and unpause dags. Hiding the paused dags means I have to learn where to toggle showing the paused dags before I can unpause it.
Status: Operator written, need to write a test DAG on my machine to confirm that it works as designed.
This is ready to go!

I'm not sure about your install, but in ours, the HomeView needs to be primarily a dashboard of current status. And there is no simple way to hide old DAGs. The default view for a developer is very different from that of a DevOps person.
@bolkedebruin can you take another look at this? Is there some way I can trigger another test run?
I added screenshots to the PR, so people can see.
@bolkedebruin @r39132 plz check again and let me know if its fine, then I can do a final rebase.
I think I've addressed all of the above. Please confirm and I'll squash down the latest commit.

It sounds like you're using Pause as a proxy for hiding old dags? That seems like a somewhat orthogonal problem.

I use Pause as a temporary state when we need to make operational changes, so having the HomeView show paused dags is pretty important for understanding our current status.
Why was this not merged?

I would prefer if show paused dags were the default (ie without any query params passed) and users could optionally hide paused dags, so that
1. The default is the same as what we have now
2. People who miss the "hide paused dags" link won't get confused if their dags disappear (they must opt-in to hiding dags)

That actually requires a config param, as the links would no longer solve
the underlying issue. The point is to have the default uncluttered so you
can scan the HomeView. Having to click a link to get to the Scanable View
makes not a useful feature. Basically, you only need to un-pause something
once, but you need to scan the list regularly.

Thanks,
Ben

this will break existing installations which place slugs into `allowed_teams`... should be introduce `allowed_team_ids` and deprecate `allowed_teams` instead?
Good question. It looks reasonable to me. Sorry I was a little slow on the review. LGTM.
how about sorting the dags so that paused ones are displayed last? would that fit your use-case?

Well, not really.

Given the number of DAGs that get loaded into the DB over time, we need to
have a default hidden state for many of them. Pause works well for this, as
it means we are also hiding items that aren't accidentally running. Really,
we don't want them in the list, and our experience is that this is a
challenge for us, as we get into the hundreds of DAGs over time.

To be clear, we can run this as a cherry pick, but I can't really imagine
that this isn't a useful tool for most if not all users in a mature
installation.

Thanks,
Ben

This is a clear improvement in library logging etiquette.

For a useful primer, see [this blog post](http://pythonsweetness.tumblr.com/post/67394619015/use-of-logging-package-from-within-a-library).

See also the [Python docs](https://docs.python.org/2/howto/logging.html#configuring-logging-for-a-library).

Earlier, before the rolling restarts, we used the daemonize gunicorn in order to make sure the processes it launches are terminated properly. Have you tested whether children of the main process are correctly terminated when the main process terminates?

kill -TERM `pid` . The way gunicorn used to be started is that "airflow webserver" does not leave itself running. Ie. after forking gunicorn, the airflow process itself exits immediately.

From what I can see the webserver should follow a similar pattern to the other services, e.g.:

```
stdout = open(stdout, 'w+')
         stderr = open(stderr, 'w+')

         ctx = daemon.DaemonContext(
             pidfile=TimeoutPIDLockFile(pid, -1),
             files_preserve=[handle],
             stdout=stdout,
             stderr=stderr,
         )
```

Thanks for your contribution.

See my comments on #1731 and how the submitter corrected it on #1733

In addition to a call for references, we also want to acclimate potential future contributors with the apache commit guidelines. This is required before I can merge your change.

For example, change your commit message to active voice : "Add IFTTT as Airflow user" and please create a JIRA for this change. Then preface your commit message with the JIRA so it reads as "[AIRFLOW-XXX] Add IFTTT as Airflow user"
This PR looks dead. I will go ahead and correct the issues when I merge it.

@PedroMDuarte Plz follow the 50/72 rules for commit messages, i.e. commit heading should not be longer than 50 chars. You can write detailed description with each line limited to 72 chars.
